title: Why does my voice sound like a cartoon voice in my video? How can I fix that problem? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s a couple of possibilities: The recording has gone odd, possibly by recording at one speed setting and playing back at a higher one. Use your editing tool and see if there are any speed settings that have been changed.Your voice does sound like that. You sound different on a recording than you do to yourself. Add in a low quality mic or speakers that are dropping some of the bass resonance, and you can sound very squeaky.

Many people are surprised the first time they hear a recording of their own voice. It normally sounds deeper in our own head, so the recording reveals it's actually higher. If you edit your voice, (for example, in Audacity) is it still yours?
